snippet: A European Union panel recommended banks be forced to split traditional lending from riskier trades as a way to safeguard the financial system.
abstract: European Union panel recommends that banks be forced to split traditional lending from riskier trades as a way to safeguard the financial system; calls for European banks to adopt a rule like Glass-Steagall.
lead_paragraph: A European Union panel recommended banks be forced to split traditional lending from riskier trades as a way to safeguard the financial system.

headline.main: Europe’s Banks Urged to Keep Trading and Lending Operations Separate
headline.print_headline: Europe’s Banks Urged To Isolate Trading Side
